text: So, how does everyone handle their ip exclusion lists for reporting in HubSpot, GA, and other things with remote employees who have IP's that change every now and then?
<@U25PYL3Q8> didnt you mention using ghostery for stuff right?
we use ghostry as a backup, we do all the ips in HubSpot and GA, then we have our team members use ghostry

Hey all, I wrote a little script today to parse the sitemap.xml document and search each of the webpages that are on it for a string of text.  This is good if you are looking for references to certain documents or urls that show up in google search console, or if you are looking to find pages that contain certain links or scripts.

Not sure if you'll ever need it lol but I've had to do this a tiem or two and always parse the xml file then write a script on the page with an array of urls, just figured this would be easier to drop in teh console on the sitemap.xml page and let it do the work
This is in my github gists, not sure why it just injected this and didn't offer the url <https://gist.github.com/NickDeckerDevs>
Converted that to ES5 for the non babel users out thereâ€¦
If you are doing it in the chrome browser in the console this shouldn't be an issue, but thanks
